meanings.definition: To tie or bind with a ligature.
meanings.sent1: She was ligating the rope around the package to secure it.
meanings.sent2: The surgeon was ligating the blood vessels during the operation.
meanings.sent3: The magician was ligating the scarves together to create a colorful illusion.
meanings.sent4: The vines ligating the trees in the forest symbolized unity and strength.
meanings.sent5: The image of ligating the threads together stayed vivid in her mind.

meanings.definition: To join together with a ligature.
meanings.sent1: He was ligating the papers with a ribbon for presentation.
meanings.sent2: The artist was ligating different elements in the painting to create a cohesive composition.
meanings.sent3: The chef was ligating the flavors in the dish to surprise the taste buds.
meanings.sent4: The music ligating various instruments together filled the room with harmony.
meanings.sent5: The idea of ligating the storylines in his novel made it more engaging.
